notifications.linkText: Making custom components for declarative use
notifications.body: Vaadin introduced declarative syntax for initializing screen compositions in Framework 7.4. Since its release, declarative serialization and initialization have been associated for the most part with the Vaadin Designer product, where this syntax is used to describe a user interface design in a compact, procedure-free format.
notifications.title: Making custom components for declarative use

notifications.body:
Vaadin Framework 8.1.4 is now available.

The release contains bug fixes and small enhancements.

Upgrade to 8.1.4 is suggested for all Framework 8 users.
notifications.title: Vaadin Framework 8.1.4 released

notifications.body: The Free Vaadin 8 Certification week officially ended on Sunday evening last week. During this past week over 1250 developers from our community signed up for the certification and tried to pass the examination. This was the strongest attendance during our free trial periods in the history of Vaadin!
notifications.title: Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week Digest

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Data and Structure
notifications.body: This is a series of tutorials for upgrading the Table component to Grid. It will be performed by migrating to Framework 7 style of Grid, then migrating to Framework 8. As a reference, Gridv7 is the Grid component from Framework 7, while Grid is the latest Grid component in Framework 8. Naturally, you can also migrate straight from Table to the Framework 8 style Grid.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Data and Structure

notifications.linkText: Responsive Design Made Easy with CSS Grid and Web Components
notifications.body: Responsive design is used to create good user interfaces across all display sizes and devices. Generally, this means the size, position, and visibility of each section within the UI is dependent on the display size. Building responsive layouts with CSS grid allows us to easily define a grid, element positions and sizes within the grid for each breakpoint we define.
notifications.title: Responsive Design Made Easy with CSS Grid and Web Components

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Components
notifications.body: This is a series of tutorials for upgrading the Table component to Grid.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Components

notifications.body: For this month’s Vaadin Community Spotlight I interviewed Jorge Salazar, a Java Developer with 10 years of experience, who works for Pyxis, a Latin American company specializing in software development and IT services. Jorge lives in Uruguay where he not only is a member of the software development team at Pyxis, but also an entrepreneur, being the co-founder of Guayoyo Labs, a startup focused on Security Ops services. Jorge has been successfully using Vaadin Framework for some years now. Let’s find out his thoughts about it!
notifications.title: Community Spotlight - August 2017

notifications.body:
Vaadin Framework 8.1.3 is now available.

The release contains bug fixes and small enhancements. In total there are now 73 changes since 8.1.0 release.

Upgrade to 8.1.3 is suggested for all Framework 8 users.
notifications.title: Vaadin Framework 8.1.3 released

notifications.body:
Join us for a webinar where we talk about the differences between Spring and Java EE and show you how to get started with building a web application in both. A hands-on webinar hosted by Vaadin oldtimers Thomas Mattsson and Alejandro Duarte.

Webinar takes place on Thursday September 28, 2017 @ 2PM CEST
notifications.title: Webinar: Starting a new project with Spring and Java EE

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Selection
notifications.body: This is a series of tutorials for upgrading the Table component to Grid. It will be performed by migrating to Framework 7 style of Grid, then migrating to Framework 8. As a reference, Gridv7 is the Grid component from Framework 7, while Grid is the latest Grid component in Framework 8. Naturally, you can also migrate straight from Table to the Framework 8 style Grid.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Selection

notifications.body: A great web application needs awesome charts to visualize data in a human readable form, so let’s have a look at how to add some to yours. Let’s first consider the different options we have for creating charts; Vaadin Pro and Prime come with Vaadin Charts, Vaadin Directory has several add-ons for Charts and there are several chart JavaScript libraries on the Internet you could integrate.
notifications.title: Charts with Vaadin

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Basic
notifications.body: As promised earlier, here is the first and most basic example. As a reference, Gridv7 is the Grid component from Framework 7, while Grid is the latest Grid component in Framework 8. Naturally, you can also migrate straight from Table to the Framework 8 style Grid.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Basic

notifications.linkText: Welcome to the Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week!
notifications.body: After the releases of Vaadin 8 and 8.1 we are happy to announce that our certifications have been updated as well. We’d like to celebrate this with you during our upcoming Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week. You’ll get the chance to join our more than 1000 Certified Vaadin developers all over the globe and prove your Vaadin skills with no cost at all. The Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week will take place from September 4th to September 10th 2017.
notifications.title: Welcome to the Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week!

notifications.body: We’re happy to announce the release of Vaadin Charts 5 with support for Polymer 2! Vaadin Charts offers a range of custom elements for data visualization, from simple column charts to complex combinations of more than one type of chart.
notifications.title: Adding charts to Polymer 2 apps

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Intro
notifications.body: Vaadin Grid was announced over two years ago, and since then it has evolved with many new features and enhancements. If this wasn’t enough killer for the Table component, then the announcement of Vaadin Framework 8 earlier this year, with explicit deprecation of Table, places it in a critical state, and it’s now time to upgrade your source code and enjoy the latest features, bug fixes, and all latest updates.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Intro

notifications.body: A key element in any successful open-source project is its community. In the case of Vaadin, the community collaborates mostly by asking and answering questions in forums, reporting issues, suggesting improvements, contributing with patches to the core products or with add-ons published at vaadin.com/directory.
notifications.title: Community Spotlight - July 2017

notifications.body: I’m pleased to announce that Vaadin Framework 8.1 is now declared as stable. As discussed earlier, it brings the much awaited component support to the Grid’s columns, Vaadin 8 style support for hierarchical data structures (Tree and TreeGrid), improved drag and drop support, and enhanced OSGi (& Liferay 7) features.
notifications.title: Vaadin Framework 8.1 is now stable

notifications.body:
Want to have a Vaadin presentation at your local event? We've received really good feedback and are happy to join you and your group as well – let's schedule it together!

Contact Vaadin Advocate Ville Ingman at ville@vaadin.com for more info.
notifications.title: Speech at your meetup or company?
